trans-unit.source: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to backup from a Windows Server or Windows Client to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to backup from a Windows Server or Windows Client to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure

trans-unit.source: This article covers the steps required to back up Windows server or Windows client files and folders to Azure.
trans-unit.target: This article covers the steps required to back up Windows server or Windows client files and folders to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: Before you proceed, ensure that all the <link><linkText>prerequisites</linkText><title></title></link> for using Microsoft Azure Backup to protect Windows Server and Windows Client are met.
trans-unit.target: Before you proceed, ensure that all the <link><linkText>prerequisites</linkText><title></title></link> for using Microsoft Azure Backup to protect Windows Server and Windows Client are met.

trans-unit.source: The prerequisites cover tasks such as: creating a backup vault, downloading vault credentials, installing the Azure Backup Agent, and registering the machine with the vault.
trans-unit.target: The prerequisites cover tasks such as: creating a backup vault, downloading vault credentials, installing the Azure Backup Agent, and registering the machine with the vault.

trans-unit.source: Backup files
trans-unit.target: Backup files

trans-unit.source: Once the machine is registered, open the Microsoft Azure Backup mmc snap-in.
trans-unit.target: Once the machine is registered, open the Microsoft Azure Backup mmc snap-in.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Search result</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Search result</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Schedule Backup
trans-unit.target: Click Schedule Backup

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Schedule Backup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Schedule Backup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the items you wish to back up.
trans-unit.target: Select the items you wish to back up.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup on a Windows Server/Windows Client (i.e without System Center Data Protection Manager) enables you to protect files and folders.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup on a Windows Server/Windows Client (i.e without System Center Data Protection Manager) enables you to protect files and folders.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Items to Backup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Items to Backup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify the backup schedule and retention policy which is explained in detail in the following <link><linkText>article</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Specify the backup schedule and retention policy which is explained in detail in the following <link><linkText>article</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Choose the method for sending the initial backup.
trans-unit.target: Choose the method for sending the initial backup.

trans-unit.source: Your choice of completing the initial seeding is dependent on the amount of data you wish to back up and your internet upload link speed.
trans-unit.target: Your choice of completing the initial seeding is dependent on the amount of data you wish to back up and your internet upload link speed.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to back up GB’s/TB’s of data over a high latency, low bandwidth connection, it is recommended that you complete the initial backup by shipping a disk to the nearest Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to back up GB’s/TB’s of data over a high latency, low bandwidth connection, it is recommended that you complete the initial backup by shipping a disk to the nearest Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: This is called “Offline Backup” and is covered in detail in this <link><linkText>article</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This is called “Offline Backup” and is covered in detail in this <link><linkText>article</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you have a sufficient bandwidth connection we recommend that you complete the initial backup over the network.
trans-unit.target: If you have a sufficient bandwidth connection we recommend that you complete the initial backup over the network.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Initial Backup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Initial Backup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the schedule backup process is completed, go back to the mmc snap in and click Back up Now to complete the initial seeding over the network.
trans-unit.target: After the schedule backup process is completed, go back to the mmc snap in and click Back up Now to complete the initial seeding over the network.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backup now</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup now</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the initial seeding is completed, the Jobs view in the Azure Backup console indicates the status.
trans-unit.target: After the initial seeding is completed, the Jobs view in the Azure Backup console indicates the status.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>IR complete</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>IR complete</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps
